qinfo
	graph-without-annotations: matching algorithm
		we only need to distinguish *one* node's connections
		slots are like inline function calls
		parts are like function bodies
		we're attempting to tell them apart using pattern matching / keyword matching
			ideally without the algorithm being too complex
			the input is usually well-defined
				but this may not hold if we disregard the inter-part connection
		token-level pattern match
			regexp-like interpreted-language matching
				the only wildcard-like pattern is the slot - a bunch of tokens *with internally-matching brackets*
			NFA with a stack:
				brackets inside the pattern advances the state along the stack direction
			ideally we should use a DFA-with-a-stack
			conversion-from-NFA should be possible
		the find-all-parts game
			find individual parts using pattern matching
			then bind the params for each first-part and see if we can match the later parts
		this provides an interpretation of the entire file... but what about the AC?
			graph-like add-something interface
			graph-like reconnecting
			parameter co-editing
	implement the unique-per pattern

				formulate the callback-setting as qinfo-fn?

							and the comment / qinfo explaining what the hell it is

							then attempt to locate a keyword near the query

	key concepts
		template: code / asset / manual jobs that contribute to the *code*
			templates can have annotations too
				specify parameters and their class requirements
			templates can create places
				e.g. MUnityCharacterBehavior::per_frame_callback
			templates can fulfill functionalities
		place: a marked code range that can hold annotations
			member place - objects defined here can be obtained from any object of a specific class
		functionality: a state change / object creation that specifies some human-side goal
		object / class: runtime concepts as in their standard meanings
			class can be additionally annotated with semantical metadata
				e.g. CImage.int(width)
			metadata-classes can inherit each other
				meta_class MUnity:MGameEngine
		state: a set of assertions optionally attached to an object
			e.g.
				game_running
				temp_buf0.holding_vertex_data
		tools: shell scripts intended for human application
			e.g. "run unity"
